lineup: DJ Python, Carlos Souffront, CZ Wang & Regularfantasy, Eamon Harkin & Justin Carter, Jacob Meehan, JADALAREIGN & Mike Servito, Ladiez Drink Free
information:
3… 2… 1… Ladiez Drink Free unifies the individual talent of Brooklyn bombshells: Perna, MARI, and Drupe Jam. In addition to incorporating the erotic component of old school rave flyers into the contemporary dance world, this trio has nailed the singular sound of club euphoria. They ring in the new year with a nasty, tour-de-force four-hour set.

After his BBC Essential Mix, DJ Python continually explores the art of multi-genre and is no stranger to milestone heights. The power of his artistry, however, lies in the gentle moments and subtle fluctuations he laces within extended sets.

Eamon Harkin and Justin Carter are stalwart veteran DJs of the New York scene, having cut their teeth in the warehouse and loft parties of the early aughts, founding the Mister Saturday Night and Mister Sunday parties in 2009 and eventually opening Nowadays. They've been residents on NTS and The Lot and toured on six continents, but they are always most at home in the booth they built. Whether they're playing from the chuggy and hypnotic corners of their record bags or the joyous and deep, they'll soundtrack the dance to welcome New Year's Day perfectly. 

Following Eamon and Justin, CZ Wang and Regularfantasy team up at noon for cheeky bangers on cheeky bangers. CZ is usually found in Brooklyn watering holes as a DJ or emcee. His professional ear has been tuned through his work as a sound engineer, making him the perfect accomplice for this back to back with one of Canada’s most beloved vocal house selectors.
 
Before Jacob Meehan started producing, he was already ingrained into the circuit of queer collectives, festivals, and parties — WHOLE Festival, BUTTONS, CockTail d’Amore, and Club Toilet to name a few. From Chicago to Berlin, his selections revel in the power of sensual gratification. 

JADALAREIGN & Mike Servito take over for a venture into various dancefloor disciplines. Their collective sound keeps things hot before Carlos Souffront takes over. With ties to prolific Detroit-based labels and parties such as Interdimensional Transmissions and No Way Back, his long standing radio show, Crush Collision, is easily overlooked. Such accomplishments come secondary for Carlos, who cites context and character as most important. He responds to dance floor shifts with energizing micro-genres and masterful selections from his lifelong collection of crate gold. We follow his lead and let the music speak for itself.

22:00 - 02:00 Ladiez Drink Free
02:00 - 06:00 DJ Python
06:00 - 12:00 Eamon Harkin & Justin Carter
12:00 - 16:00 CZ Wang & Regularfantasy
16:00 - 19:00 Jacob Meehan

23:00 - close Carlos Souffront

After you've arrived during your designated time window, you can stay as long as you'd like, so long as you abide by our safer space policy (more on that below). You're also welcome to come and go as you please. Re-entry is based on capacity and is not guaranteed.

Nonstop attendees can attend Mister Sunday in the backyard starting at 3 pm without buying a separate ticket, and Nonstop re-entry is honored during Mister Sunday.

event_name: NYE Afterhours: Jesse Perez / Jeff Sorkowitz
ticket_category: 1st release, 2nd release, All Night & All Morning Pass
information:
Thanks to a once-a-year 24 hour liquor license, SILO is hosting Afters on New Year's morning!

2-for-1 Mimosas.
Complimentary Pop-Tarts served at 7 AM.
With an extended set from Miami afters legend, Jesse Perez.

Jesse Perez is a larger than life character whose music is always characterized by a massive serving of bass. No doubt influenced by the bass music of his Miami homeland, he is very much part of a fresh and exciting crew of producers making bootylicious house music with ghetto rawness, percolating percussions and firing vocals that always send crowds wild.  

His latest effort, "Fake" on his own Mr Nice Guy Records is a big rubber banger with rapped vocals, dirty drums and the sort of attitude that will have dancers in raptures. Before now he has released on essential labels like Hot Creations, I’m A House Gangster, BPitch Control and Eats Everything’s Edible and his music always has a tongue in cheek charm and real sense of humor. It swings and is funky, touches on hip house and often comes stuffed with skewed synths that never fail to make their mark. Certainly one of the most prominent artists in the game right now, his bump and grind sounds are in demand all over the world, and for good reason.

It’s all about Vinyl Nights with TonyDeepDisco on Thursdays in the Water Tower. Get down to the groovy beats as the DJ spins classic vinyl, from soulful disco to deep house. Whether you’re a vinyl lover or just in the mood to move, this weekly throwdown promises a night of pure rhythm and good times. Come for the beats, stay for the views.

Step into the world of TonyDeepDisco, a New York City-based DJ and vinyl aficionado who seamlessly blends the timeless energy of the disco era with the innovative, futuristic vibes of deep house music. Known for his unparalleled vinyl collection and a deep appreciation for both fashion and art, TonyDeepDisco is a true connoisseur of culture—curating experiences that are as much about the vibe as they are about the groove.

information:
All-night sets with Nowadays resident and Sound Signature boss Theo Parrish tend to be occasions to remember.

Known for his unparalleled ability to blend genres and craft immersive, groove-laden soundscapes, Parrish seamlessly mixes rare tracks and oddities with timeless classics. Whether he's exploring the rhythmic intricacies of Detroit's underground scene or spinning international treasures, his sets are a testament to his passion for music and his unmatched intuition as a selector, honed over decades perfecting his craft.

With his vast knowledge of music history and dedication to digging for hidden gems, each track played will be a new discovery, comprising a full journey through the deep, soulful, and eclectic sounds of house, jazz, funk, and beyond.

event_name: Tim Reaper / Mia Koden + Sister Zo / Russell E.L. Butler
artists: Tim Reaper, Mia Koden, Sister Zo, Russell E.L. Butler
lineup: Tim Reaper , Mia Koden , Sister Zo , Russell E.L. Butler
information:
A leading figure in the modern jungle revival, London's Tim Reaper is a nearly impossible artist to miss. His explosive productions and DJ sets have stretched drum + bass to new limits worldwide, with rapid breakbeats and teeth-rattling low end frequencies pushing the genre and its dancers further and further on the hardcore continuum. Prepare for nonstop shakers with Reaper all night long in The Sound Room.

Mia Koden, formerly of Sicaria Sound, makes her long-awaited solo debut at Public Records. After her standout self-release "Hot Take / I did" followed by "Decode" on Ilian Tape, her dub- and system-shaking take on bass music has spread like a wildfire. The South Sudanese / British DJ and producer joins Brooklyn's Sister Zo for a harmonious night of 2-step, UK bass, broken beat, and dubstep in The Atrium.

UPSTAIRS, Russell E.L. Butler shares a metaphysical taste of minimal synth, electronic body music, and stripped-back house. Their productions have been featured by DJ Mag, T4T LUV NRG, Tresor.

The first installation of Axon Series will serve as a fundraiser for The Living Gallery. ticket_category: Early bird, General admission, RSVP / $10 til 11pm (no re-entry) / $15 til 12am
information:
Get ready for a night of raw, unfiltered energy as the legendary Traxx (a self-described "artist of sound") takes over the decks for an all-night set that will transport us through the depths of underground house, electro, and industrial rhythms.

A true pioneer of the Chicago sound, Traxx has earned his reputation as a master of both the dancefloor and the art of crate-digging, with a style that blends dark, hypnotic grooves with explosive, high-energy beats. His sets are known for their unpredictable twists and turns, expertly navigating through deep cuts, rare gems, and cutting-edge productions that challenge conventions and push the boundaries of electronic music.

In both his DJing and his production (with releases on Gigolo, Relief, Muzique, M/O/S, and Crème), Traxx is committed to analog approaches over digital smoothness, DJing vinyl and producing with hardware. His sound recalls the past but pushes for the future with an overtly emotional and experimental approach.

Whether you're a long-time fan or a newcomer to his unique style, this all-night extended set is a rare opportunity to witness one of the most influential figures in the scene delivering his signature sound with plenty of space to stretch out.

///

Entry is at the discretion of our door staff. Online purchases are limited to four tickets maximum per person. If tickets are sold out here, we always hold a good amount at the door. We will do our best to admit those without tickets but entrance is not guaranteed.

Violence, non-consensual touching, racist, homophobic, transphobic, sexist, ageist or other discriminatory language, and leering are not allowed within our walls or in our back yard. If someone says or does something to make you feel uncomfortable while you’re here, let us know.
pick_blurb: A pioneer of the Chicago sound and one of the most underrated DJs in the world, Traxx, locks in for an all-nighter at Nowadays.

artists: Josh Wink, Toribio, Heidy P, Sasha Crush
lineup: Josh Wink , Toribio , Lloyd, Heidy P, Sasha Crush
information:
Philadelphia-born and -based Josh Wink blurs the lines between techno and house music with an intrepid approach to genre boundaries. Co-founder of the label Ovum Recordings with King Britt, Wink has surrounded himself with minimal and '90s progressive tied together through emotional and melodic sentiments. Brooklyn's Bring Dat Ass party-thrower Toribio opens the room with plenty of soul, vibrance, rhythm, and heart to go around.

DJ Lloyd is the host of DREAM ON on The Lot Radio and a regular at hotspot Nightmoves. He is joined by another Heidy P, resident of queer nightlife collective XOXA, who has a shared love of vocal house, groovy disco and uplifting rhythms.

NTS resident Sasha Crush steps UPSTAIRS. A NY native, her taste is influenced by the dancefloor, with an inclination toward disco, soul, synth-pop, funk, freestyle + more.

Public Records aims to provide a safer space. We reject all forms of discrimination, including racism, misogyny, transphobia, homophobia, sexism, and other aggressive behavior. Consent is paramount. event_name: Chus On The Roof - The Recovery Party
lineup: DJ Chus , Camila Jun, Matt Martinez
information:
Chus makes his debut on The Roof at Superior Ingredients. This is a climate controlled, enclosed roof but with glass walls that afford spectacular views of the Manhattan skyline.

CHUS - Chus L. Esteban, also known as DJ CHUS, started his professional career in Madrid during the '80s acid-house movement at Club Alien. He then became a resident DJ at Kadoc Club in the Portuguese Algarve, where he witnessed the dance music explosion of the 90s and developed his style, eventually creating the Iberican Sound. Chus has had residencies worldwide and has collected many awards throughout his over 30-year-long career, which showcases his wide range of music styles and unlimited love for different genres. 

CAMILA JUN - Authentic, unique style and a peculiar stage presence: Camila Jun is one of the hottest names in the current Brazilian electronic music scene .DJ, music producer and a businesswoman, she has performed at the greatest festivals and parties all over Brazil and in many other countries, such as Spain, Croatia, Portugal, United States and more. 

MATT MARTINEZ - Matt's DJing style is rooted in the deep musical heritage of his illustrious musical family. Between older brothers Steve and Chris AKA The Martinez Brothers, and a father (Steve Sr.) who spent his formative clubbing years at seminal venues like The Loft and The Paradise Garage, Matt has taken all this experience and knowledge and created his own unique style.

information:
Jaunt is a short journey or excursion for pleasure. Featuring Lady Harley, Wahala.wav, EEVEE, Dessi, CRTR, and Wauce; this diverse group of surging local talent was carefully curated to leave every individual with a moment to take home with them. 

From Deep House and Garage, to Jersey Club and Ghetto Tech -- this night will know no bounds. Come to dance, sing, and forget about all the outside noise as we walk you through this short, sweet, intimate journey.

information:
Get ready to experience KCR's debut Community Night at SILO— where New York’s underground comes alive with a killer lineup of boundary-pushing artists. We’re bringing you an eclectic mix of DJ sets that will keep you moving all night.  

Established in 2017, Karachi Community Radio (KCR) operates as a community-driven project with a focus on archiving, promoting, and advancing contemporary music and art. Our intervention of sound and space is dedicated to the cultivation and expansion of the electronic music and DIY experimental audio-visual scene, particularly from a South Asian perspective. Over the years, KCR has extended its influence on a global scale, gaining recognition for producing Pakistan’s first "Boiler Room" event, which has garnered millions of views worldwide. Additionally, KCR has curated projects for prestigious platforms such as Biennale, SXSW Festival, Cannes Film Festival, Lot Radio, Dub Lab, and Public Records, among others.

event_name: Sorry Records with Club Chow, Pacer, Tony G b2b Nick Boyd
promoters: Bossa Nova Civic Club, Sorry Records
artists: Club Chow, Tony G (2), Nick Boyd
lineup: Club Chow , Pacer, Tony G (2) b2b Nick Boyd
information:
"Chicago, Chicago, that toddlin’ town…"
-Frank Sinatra

"Lake Shore Drive is the fastest street in America"
- Connor O'Malley

︵‿︵‿︵＼ʕ •ᴥ•ʔ／︵‿︵‿︵
A monthly party from America’s wackiest rave record label Sorry Records

We’re back at Bossa for our first party of the new year with a very special Tony G Takeover featuring a lineup of the finest disc jockeys with roots in his new home of Chicago for what is sure to be a cute and funky night. Proud to present two Bossa debuts from Club Chow and Pacer, as well as a deeply appreciated b2b reunion from Tony G and Nick Boyd (me).

Tossing it to Tony here — 

I first met Kevin Chow when we all pooled our money to buy and rip a copy of the double 12” of Duran Duran’s cover of ‘White Lines’ (impossible to pick a favorite of the 8 mixes but the Sound Factory Dub 2 goes crazy!) - but I’d been aware of Club Chow for much longer than that. A staple of the queer underground on dance floors and in DJ booths alike, Kevin is known far and wide as an energetic mixer, tireless promoter, and an extremely savvy dresser. He has held down residencies at Chicago’s Steamworks Baths and Dim Sum & Drag, curates the leftfield rager Club Gauche and queer day function Forbidden Fruitz, and is a regular at queer parties across Chicago. Kevin’s stock is booming after his recent Hot Mass debut and we’re thrilled to host him for a peak time Sunday night set at Bossa. 

Chicago lost a real one when Pacer moved to New York last year. Perhaps best known as one half of the DJ duo Dasani Boys with his brother Akeem, Ahmad Asani is a force behind the decks on his own, evidenced by his fantastic ‘Pacer Test’ radio residency on Chicago’s Beloved Radio (highly recommend a deep dive!) as well as past live engagements opening for the likes of Galcher Lustwerk, Charli XCX, and Virgil Abloh. I love Pacer’s ability to balance deep and meditative cuts with party rockers, a perfect formula for opening up the night at Bossa. 

Lastly, we’ll close the night out with a joyous b2b reunion set from our founders Nick Boyd and Tony G. If you’re reading this, you probably know us - two dedicated DJs, dancers, and music lovers. We’ve only done a few public b2bs over the year, most notably at Bossa on Halloween 2022 and at my old Giambrone & Co party at Mansions. We’re always looking to throw each other and the audience some curveballs, so expect a bit of late night soup to close things out.

Party runs 10pm to 4am and is free before 11pm, $10 after.

"One of the underground’s best dance labels"
- No Tags Podcast, on Sorry Records

"Loveable, Hard Working, Absolutely Rowdy Party Starters, Speaker Freaks... yea I dunno, what more can you say about Sorry Records? One of New York's hardest working crews, and a bottomless well of support for the city's scene."
- Sweat Equity

“Since its foundation in 2015, Sorry Records has become a critical outpost in New York’s dance-music scene. The label balances an unwavering commitment to the city’s dance-music history with a dead-serious approach to having a good time. Their best material seems like it could have come out in the ‘90s, were it not for the of-the-moment production techniques and references in the liner notes.”
- Michael McKinney, Passion of the Weiss
